decks.notes: This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on efficiently deploying low-cost creatures and using combat tricks to overwhelm the opponent. The deck utilizes a mixture of creatures with abilities that boost their power and toughness, as well as removal spells to deal with opposing threats. The key strategy is to maintain a steady stream of creatures on the battlefield, while also having the flexibility to adapt to different game situations. By leveraging the synergy between creatures and spells, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and outpace the opponent's defenses.

This deck focuses on utilizing low-cost creatures and ramping to apply consistent pressure on opponents. It aims to disrupt opponents' strategies with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Archon of Emeria, while also providing versatile removal with Skyclave Apparition. Collected Company enables quick creature deployment, while Elspeth, Storm Slayer serves as a powerful finisher. The mana base is streamlined to ensure smooth gameplay, with a mix of green and white sources. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with efficient creatures and disruptive elements.

The main concept of this deck revolves around putting pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Archon of Emeria and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Skyclave Apparition. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of early aggression and disruptive elements, utilizing cards like Collected Company to maintain board presence and tempo. The land base is designed to support the aggressive creatures by ensuring consistent mana sources. Overall, the deck focuses on establishing an early advantage and maintaining pressure on the opponent to secure a swift victory.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent with low-cost aggressive creatures like Soul-Scar Mage, Monastery Swiftspear, and Emberheart Challenger, while also utilizing burn spells like Reckless Rage and Torch the Tower to control the board and clear a path for your creatures. Additionally, cards like Academic Dispute and Heroes' Hangout provide card advantage and help maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to maintain a fast and aggressive pace to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

This Orzhov Control deck focuses on disrupting opponents with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress, while also utilizing removal spells like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse to control the board. The deck also includes creatures like Gifted Aetherborn and Preacher of the Schism for stabilization, as well as powerful threats like Blade of the Oni and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse for closing out games. The mana base is designed to support the deck's double black and double white mana requirements, ensuring consistency in casting spells.

This aggro deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent using low-cost spells and creatures with prowess abilities. The deck utilizes a combination of burn spells like Fiery Impulse and creatures like Soul-Scar Mage and Monastery Swiftspear to apply pressure early in the game. The addition of cards like Heroes' Hangout and Riverpyre Verge helps to maintain a consistent mana base for casting spells efficiently. The deck aims to dominate the board and win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells in order to quickly reduce their life total to zero. The deck focuses on dealing damage quickly and efficiently, utilizing cards like Emberheart Challenger, Soul-Scar Mage, and Monastery Swiftspear to apply pressure early on. With a mix of cheap creatures and instant-speed burn spells, this deck aims to control the board and finish off the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The focus of this UW Control deck is to maintain control of the board through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. The deck utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Narset, and Elspeth, as well as sweepers like Supreme Verdict to control the game. The inclusion of Kaheera as a companion allows for additional synergy with creature spells. The deck also includes card draw like Consult the Star Charts and March of Otherworldly Light to ensure consistency in drawing answers and threats. Overall, the key concept revolves around control and resource management to outlast opponents.

The deck focuses on equipping creatures with powerful equipment such as Colossus Hammer and Leyline Axe to deal massive damage quickly. It also utilizes cards like Sigarda's Aid to cheat equipment into play and Fervent Champion for additional combat tricks. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient equipment to end the game before the opponent can establish their own board presence. The deck aims to be fast and relentless, putting pressure on the opponent from the beginning of the game.

The key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient and aggressive creatures, utilizing cheap spells and abilities to quickly push for damage. By combining powerful aggro creatures like Emberheart Challenger, Monastery Swiftspear, and Soul-Scar Mage with instant and sorcery spells like Reckless Rage and Torch the Tower, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and end the game as quickly as possible. The mana base is designed to support this strategy by providing access to both red and blue mana sources to cast a variety of spells and maintain tempo.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Golgari colors to create a fast-paced aggressive strategy. It aims to quickly build a board presence with cards like Gilded Goose and Cauldron Familiar, while also disrupting the opponent with removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay. The key synergy revolves around sacrificing creatures to trigger effects, such as Witch's Oven and Scavenger's Talent. The deck also includes card draw options like Dredger's Insight to maintain resources. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and disruption.

This deck focuses on assembling combos using various cards and mechanics, such as Carnage, Crimson Chaos, Rona, Herald of Invasion, and Nashi, Searcher in the Dark. It also utilizes cards like Tinybones Joins Up and Thoughtseize for disruption and card advantage. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and The Meathook Massacre while setting up for powerful combos. The inclusion of cards like Malcolm, Alluring Scoundrel and Overlord of the Balemurk provide additional utility and synergy within the deck. Overall, the strategy revolves around creating game-winning combinations while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with green creatures and utilizing Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx to generate massive amounts of green mana. The deck then uses this mana to play high-powered creatures and spells, overwhelming the opponent with aggressive plays. The deck also includes cards that help dig for key pieces, such as Storm the Festival and Oath of Nissa. Overall, the deck aims to quickly establish a dominant board presence and apply pressure to the opponent, while maintaining devotion to green for powerful effects.

The deck focuses on utilizing low-cost aggressive creatures to quickly pressure the opponent's life total. It also includes burn spells like Torch the Tower to directly damage the opponent and remove threats. The deck aims to establish a fast tempo by playing efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger while also having access to card draw and counter spells to ensure the opponent cannot stabilize. Den of the Bugbear provides additional offensive capabilities while Experimental Synthesizer helps generate card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early pressure and versatile spells.

The deck focuses on a blend of aggressive creatures and disruption spells to quickly apply pressure on the opponent while also controlling their hand and board state. By combining powerful creatures like Nashi and Raffine with removal spells like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse, the deck aims to establish early dominance while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Thoughtseize, Duress, and Valki, God of Lies further adds to the disruption strategy, allowing the deck to control the pace of the game and secure victory through a combination of aggression and control.

This deck focuses on fast-paced aggression, utilizing cheap spells and creatures to deal damage quickly to the opponent. Key cards like Soul-Scar Mage, Monastery Swiftspear, and Emberheart Challenger help to keep the pressure on, while cards like Reckless Rage and Monstrous Rage offer removal options to clear the way for more damage. The deck also includes cards like Boomerang Basics and Into the Flood Maw for disruption and tempo plays, ensuring the opponent struggles to stabilize or gain control of the game.
